sponsor: Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C.
briefTitle: A Study of the Efficacy and Tolerability of Pancrelipase Microtablet (MT) Capsules for the Treatment of Cystic Fibrosis-dependent Exocrine Pancreatic Insufficiency
officialTitle: A Randomized Double-blind (Withdrawal) Phase 3 Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Tolerability of Pancrelipase MT Capsules Compared With Placebo in the Treatment of Subjects With Cystic Fibrosis-dependent Exocrine Pancreatic Insufficiency

interventions.name: Placebo for Pancrease MT 10.5 or MT 21

summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the effectiveness and safety of oral pancrelipase MT in the treatment of adult and pediatric/adolescent cystic fibrosis (CF) patients with clinical symptoms of exocrine pancreatic insufficiency (EPI).

primaryOutcome.measure: Change in the Coefficient of Fat Absorption (COA-fat Percent)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 72-hours stool collection in the open-label phase to the end of 72-hours stool collection in the double-blind withdrawal phase.
